gurmukhi: moiqn ky cauik kry lwln ky Kwry Dry bYTy qbY doaU dUlih dulhI suhwvqI ]
transliteration: Motin Ke Chaouk(i) Dare Taalan Ke Khdare Ddare Baithe Tabai Dooo Doolab(i) Dulhisuhaavatee||
translation: Within the square of gems and on the seats of diamonds and jewels, the bride and bridegroom both look splendid;

gurmukhi: bydn kI Dun kInI d`Cnwid jn dInI lInI swq BwvrY jo Bwvqy so BwvqI ]35]
transliteration: Bedan Kidhoun Keenidachchhnaadh Jan Deenileenisaat Bhaavate So Bhaadarai Jo Bhaadarai Jo Bhaavate So Bhaavatee||35||
translation: Within the chanting of Vedic mantras and giving and taking of religious gifts, the marriage ceremony was completed with seven matrimonial rounds by God’s will. 35.

gurmukhi: rwq Bey bsudyv jU kIno qhwN iblwis ]pRwq Bey auT kY qbY gXo ssur ky pwis ]36]
transliteration: Raat Bhae Basudev Joo Kino Tahaan Bilaas(i)|| Praat Bhae Outh Kai Tabai Gado Sasur Ke Paas(i)||36||
translation: During the night Vasudev stayed at some place and getting up in the morning, he went to meet his father-in-law Ugarsain.36.

gurmukhi: swj smyq dey hX auqgj Aaur dey qiRguxI rQnwry ]l`C BtM ds l`C qrMgm aUNt Anyk Bry jr Bwry ]
transliteration: Saaj Samet Dae Haya Outgad Aur Dae Trigounirathndare|| Lachchh Bhatan Das Lachchh Taranad Oont Anek Bhare Jar Bhdare Jar Bhdare||
translation: Bedecked elephants and horses and threefold chariots were given (in marriage), one lakh warriors, ten lakhs of horses and many camels laden with gold were given;

gurmukhi: C`qIs kot dey dl pYdl sMig ikDo iqnky rKvwry ]kMs qbY iqh rwKn kau mno Awp Bey rQ ky hkvwry ]37]
transliteration: Chhattees Kot Dal Paidal San(i) Kidho Tinke Rakhvdare|| Kans Tabaitih Raakhanndkau Mano Aap Bhae Rath Ke Hakvdare||37||
translation: Thirty-six crores of soldiers on foot were given, who seemed to be given for the protection of all and Kansa himself became the charioteer of Devaki and Vasudev and for the protection of all.37.

gurmukhi: kMs lvwey jwq iqn skl pRbl dl swj ]Awgy qy sÍnn sunI ibD kI AsuB Avwj ]38]
transliteration: Kans Lavaae Jaat Tin Sakal Prabal Dal Saaj|| Ooge Te Sravnan Sounibidh Kiasoubh Avaaj||38||
translation: When Kansa was going with all the forces, he heard, on going forward, an invisible and inauspicious voice.38.
The heavenly speech addressed to Kansa:

gurmukhi: du`K ky hrn biR`D is`D ky krn rUp mMgl Drn AYso khXohY aucwrkY ]
transliteration: Doukkh Ke Haran Briddh Siddh Ke Karan Roop Mandal Dharan Aiso Kahyo-hai Ouchaar-kai||
translation: The Lord, remover of suffering, performer of austerities for great powers and bestower of prosperity, said through the heavenly speech,

gurmukhi: lIey khw jwq qyro kwl hY ry mUV miq AwTvo grB Xwko qoko fwrY mwr kY ]
transliteration: Leee Kahaa Jaat Tero Kaal Hai Re Moond Mat(i) Aathvo Gadabh Yaako Toko Ddarai Maar Kai||
translation: “O fool ! where are you taking your death? The eighth son of this (Devaki) will be the cause of your death;”

gurmukhi: Acrj mwn lIno mn mY ibcwr ieh kwF kY kiRpwn fwro ienhI sMGwrkY ]
transliteration: Acharj Maan Leeno Man Mai Bichaar Eh Kaadh Kai Kridaan Ddaro Inhisanhaar-kai||
translation: Being greatly astonished Kansa ruminated in his mind whether they be killed by taking out the sword;
